sub_title: Assistant Professor at Wageningen University & Research
summary:
Through my research, I have developed a profound interest in the authentication and integrity of food and believe that food that is produced in a traditional, sustainable manner carries a priceless story and tradition that should be appreciated and protected from fraud and mislabelling. I also strive to continually contribute towards bridging the gap of knowledge between the industry, the consumer and science.

Background: experienced Food Science/Meat Science researcher (PhD degree in Food Science from Stellenbosch University) with a demonstrated history of working in the higher education industry, locally (South Africa) and abroad (Europe). Skilled in food sciences, food chemistry, research and development, food integrity/authenticity, food and beverage, and leadership.

profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Title of dissertation: The authentication of regionally unique South African lamb.
The study verified the authenticity of regionally unique South African lamb using analytical techniques.  Descriptive sensory analysis, fatty acid analysis, solid-phase microextraction, stable isotope ratio analysis, near infrared reflectance spectroscopy and proton-transfer-reaction mass spectrometry proved to be very successful analytical tools and provided scientific evidence to link the sensory and chemical profiles of the meat to the characteristic diet of the animals, which is again linked to its origin.  Biomarkers (terpenes) derived from plants were detected in the meat and fat of lambs.  Consequently, the claim that fragrant bushes makes Karoo lamb unique could be verified.  The results serve as evidence for the certification of Karoo lamb and justify the protection of its indicator status in the European Union.
